meanings.definition: To bring a legal action against a plaintiff in response to a lawsuit filed against oneself.
meanings.sent1: If someone sues you, you can countersue them back.
meanings.sent2: The defendant decided to countersue the person who filed the lawsuit.
meanings.sent3: The courtroom was surprised when the defendant chose to countersue the original plaintiff.
meanings.sent4: In a twist of events, the defendant countersued the individual who initiated the legal action.
meanings.sent5: To protect their rights, the defendant had no choice but to countersue the accuser.
